perturbation.original_text: HDS' products will conform at all times to all applicable federal, state and local laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, and other enactments and industry standards, including, but not limited to, those relating to product safety.
perturbation.changed_text: HDS will endeavor for its products to generally conform to applicable federal, state, and local laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, and other enactments and industry standards, including those relating to product safety, to the extent reasonably practicable.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the guarantee of compliance with laws and regulations by introducing ambiguity. Replacing 'will conform at all times' with 'will endeavor to generally conform' and adding 'to the extent reasonably practicable' makes the obligation subjective and dependent on HDS's interpretation of what is 'reasonably practicable'. This contradicts the strict compliance expected by regulatory bodies like the FDA.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (FD&C Act) - Requires strict compliance with manufacturing and safety standards.

perturbation.original_text: HDS hereby agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Celebrity, his agents, representatives and employees  (referred to collectively as "Celebrity Indemnities")  from and against any and all claims, actions, causes or action,  damages, injuries, expenses, liabilities (joint and several), penalties fines, attorneys fees, court costs, and any other  expenses incurred by Celebrity Indemnities arising out of (1) breach by HDS of any of the terms, representations or  warranties made by HDS in this Agreement; or (2) HDS product liability or trademark patent or other proprietary right  infringement; or (3) errors, omissions, fraudulent or negligent acts by HDS, its employees, agents or subcontractors in  connection with (i) any advertising featuring Celebrity; (ii) with the performance of HDS' duties and obligations under  this Agreement; (iii) with the production, distribution, promotion, marketing and sales of products including related  product packaging; and/or (iv) with the operation and management of its production and distribution facilities,  however caused, HDS shall not be obligated to indemnify Celebrity with respect to damages which are the result of the  active negligence or willful misconduct of Celebrity.
perturbation.changed_text: HDS will reasonably endeavor to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Celebrity, his agents, representatives, and employees (referred to collectively as "Celebrity Indemnities") from and against claims arising from HDS’ actions. However, HDS’ obligation to indemnify is limited to reasonably foreseeable damages and shall not extend to indirect, special, or consequential damages.
perturbation.explanation: The change weakens the indemnification obligation by replacing "agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless...from any and all claims" with "will reasonably endeavor to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless...from claims arising from HDS’ actions." The introduction of 'reasonably foreseeable damages' introduces ambiguity, and the exclusion of 'indirect, special, or consequential damages' narrows the scope of indemnification significantly. Limiting the obligation to 'actions' is vague, making it harder to determine when indemnification is triggered. This may violate the expectations for indemnification under Georgia law, which typically covers a broader range of liabilities in contract disputes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Georgia law on indemnification - Which typically includes a broader range of liabilities than what the modified text provides.

perturbation.original_text:
HDS agrees to provide and maintain at its own expense, the following insurance coverages:

A. Commercial General Liability coverage of product liability with limits no less than $1,000,000 per occurrence  and $2,000,000 aggregate.

B. Umbrella / Excess Liability coverage inclusive of product liability with limits not less than $5,000,000 per  occurrence and aggregate.

C. Media Liability insurance with limits not less than $2,000,000 per occurrence and aggregate.
perturbation.changed_text: HDS will maintain insurance coverages it deems reasonably adequate, with the Celebrity named as an additional insured where practical. Specific coverage amounts will be subject to ongoing review and adjustment as deemed necessary by HDS.
perturbation.explanation: This alteration replaces concrete insurance coverage requirements with a subjective standard. The phrases 'reasonably adequate' and 'where practical' are vague and allow HDS to determine the level of coverage. The statement that coverage amounts will be subject to ongoing review and adjustment as deemed necessary by HDS undermines the originally specified coverage amounts and creates uncertainty. This contradicts typical contract law expectations for insurance coverage that requires very specific terms, and does not adhere to the insurance requirements of Georgia Law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Principles of Contract Law (insurance coverage specifications) and Georgia Law pertaining to Insurance Requirements
